description: Phase 1: Healthcare Directory MVP - SEO-optimized directory with 40k+ auto-populated professional profiles from scraped NMC/NDA/NPC data. Bauhaus design system.

userStories.title: Project setup: Next.js + Turborepo + Prisma
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the project scaffolded with Next.js 14 (App Router), Turborepo monorepo, Prisma ORM, and basic configuration.
acceptanceCriteria: Create monorepo structure with apps/web directory
Initialize Next.js 14 with App Router in apps/web
Add packages/database with Prisma schema location
userStories.notes: Verified: monorepo structure exists, Next.js 14 with App Router, Prisma with PostgreSQL, docker-compose, turbo.json, .env.example, pnpm dev starts, typecheck passes

userStories.title: Design system setup: Bauhaus tokens and base components
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the Bauhaus design system configured with Tailwind tokens, Outfit font, and base component styles.
acceptanceCriteria: Add Outfit font from Google Fonts
userStories.notes: Implemented: Tailwind CSS configured with Bauhaus tokens, Outfit font via next/font, hard shadows, off-white background. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Database schema: Professional model
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the Professional database model to store doctors, dentists, and pharmacists.
acceptanceCriteria: Create Professional model with fields: id (uuid), type (enum: DOCTOR/DENTIST/PHARMACIST), registration_number, full_name, full_name_ne (Nepali), photo_url, gender, address, degree, specialties (string[]), registration_date, remarks, verified (bool), slug, created_at, updated_at, last_synced_at, meta (Json)
userStories.notes: Verified: Professional model with all fields, unique constraint on registration_number, indexes on slug and type, migration created and applied, typecheck passes

userStories.title: Database schema: User and VerificationRequest models
userStories.description: As a developer, I need User and VerificationRequest models for authentication and profile claiming.
acceptanceCriteria: Create User model with: id, email, phone, password_hash, name, role (enum: USER/PROFESSIONAL/ADMIN), created_at, updated_at
Create VerificationRequest model with: id, user_id (FK), professional_id (FK), status (enum: PENDING/APPROVED/REJECTED), government_id_url, certificate_url, submitted_at, reviewed_at, reviewed_by
Add relation: User has many VerificationRequests
Add relation: Professional has optional claimed_by User
userStories.notes: Verified: User model with all fields and UserRole enum, VerificationRequest with all fields and VerificationStatus enum, User has many VerificationRequests (via user_id and reviewed_by_id), Professional has optional claimed_by User, migration created and applied, typecheck passes

userStories.title: Data import script: Doctors CSV
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a script to import doctors from nmc_doctors.csv into the database.
acceptanceCriteria: Parse CSV columns: nmc_no, full_name, address, gender, degree, remarks
Generate slug from name and nmc_no (e.g., dr-ram-sharma-12345)
userStories.notes: Implemented: scripts/import-doctors.ts created with csv-parse, slug generation (dr-name-nmcno format), upsert by registration_number, progress logging. npm script pnpm import:doctors works. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Data import script: Dentists CSV
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a script to import dentists from nda_dentists.csv.
acceptanceCriteria: Parse CSV columns: nmc_no, nda_id, name, location
Generate slug from name and nmc_no
userStories.notes: Implemented: scripts/import-dentists.ts created with CSV parsing, slug generation (dr-name-nmcno format), upsert by registration_number, NDA ID stored in meta field. npm script pnpm import:dentists works. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Data import script: Pharmacists CSV
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a script to import pharmacists from npc_pharmacists.csv.
acceptanceCriteria: Parse CSV columns: reg_no, name, reg_date, category
Generate slug from name and reg_no
Store category in meta JSON field
userStories.notes: Implemented: scripts/import-pharmacists.ts created with CSV parsing, slug generation (pharmacist-name-regno format), registration_date parsing, category stored in meta field, upsert by registration_number. npm script pnpm import:pharmacists works. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: UI Components: Button variants
userStories.description: As a developer, I need Button components following Bauhaus design system.
userStories.notes: Implemented: Button component with primary/secondary/outline/ghost variants, border-2 border-black, hard shadows, active pressed state with translate+shadow-none, uppercase font-bold tracking-wider, sm/md/lg sizes. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: UI Components: Card component
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a Card component with Bauhaus styling for professional listings.
acceptanceCriteria: Optional geometric decorator (small colored square in corner)
userStories.notes: Implemented: Card component with white background, border-4 border-black, shadow-xl (8px hard shadow), hover:-translate-y-1 effect, optional geometric decorator with color/position options, CardHeader/CardContent/CardFooter subcomponents. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Professional detail page: Basic route and layout
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to view a doctor's profile page at /doctor/[slug].
acceptanceCriteria: Fetch Professional from database by slug
Display: name, photo (placeholder if none), registration number, degree, address
Use Card component for content sections
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Implemented: app/[lang]/doctor/[slug]/page.tsx with dynamic route, database fetch by slug with notFound() for 404, displays name/photo/registration/degree/address/specialties/gender/remarks, uses Card component, mobile responsive layout with sm: breakpoints. [lang] layout created with en/ne validation. not-found.tsx added. Typecheck passes. Browser verification noted as needed (no browser tool available).

userStories.title: Professional detail page: SEO meta tags
userStories.description: As a patient, I want professional pages to appear in Google search results with proper metadata.
acceptanceCriteria: Set description with credentials and location
Add OpenGraph tags: og:title, og:description, og:image, og:type
userStories.notes: Implemented: generateMetadata function added with title format 'Dr. [Name] - [Specialty] in [Location] | Swasthya', description with credentials/location, OpenGraph (title, description, image, type: profile), Twitter card (summary), canonical URL with language alternates. Uses NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL env var with fallback. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Professional detail page: JSON-LD structured data
userStories.description: As a patient, I want Google to understand doctor profiles as structured data.
acceptanceCriteria: Add JSON-LD script to professional detail page
Use schema.org Physician type for doctors
Include: name, image, medicalSpecialty, address, identifier (NMC number)
Validate with Google Rich Results Test format
userStories.notes: Implemented: JSON-LD structured data using schema.org types (Physician for doctors, Dentist for dentists, Person+Occupation for pharmacists). Includes name, image, medicalSpecialty, address, identifier with registration number. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Professional detail page: Styled with design system
userStories.description: As a patient, I want the doctor profile page to look polished with clear typography hierarchy.
acceptanceCriteria: Specialty label is text-xs uppercase tracking-widest in primary-blue
Sections separated by border-t-2 border-black/20 dividers
Verified badge is green with Check icon in circle
Background is off-white #F0F0F0, cards are white
Icons use accent colors, not same as text
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Implemented: Name is text-4xl font-bold, specialty label is text-xs uppercase tracking-widest in primary-blue, registration number is text-sm text-gray-600, sections separated by border-t-2 border-black/20 dividers, verified badge is green with Check icon in white circle, background is off-white #F0F0F0 with white cards, icons use accent colors in rounded containers. Typecheck passes. Browser verification noted as needed.

userStories.title: Homepage: Hero section
userStories.description: As a patient, I want a compelling homepage hero to search for doctors.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section with display text: 'FIND YOUR DOCTOR' (text-6xl lg:text-8xl font-black uppercase)
Color blocking: right panel with blue #1040C0 background and geometric shapes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Implemented: Homepage with hero section - FIND YOUR DOCTOR display text (text-6xl lg:text-8xl font-black uppercase), subtitle, search input with border-4 border-foreground, primary red search button, blue right panel with geometric shapes (circle, square, triangle), mobile responsive with color accent bar, categories section. Typecheck passes. Browser verification noted as needed.

userStories.title: Search results page: Basic listing
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to see search results for doctors.
acceptanceCriteria: Query database with ILIKE on full_name, degree, address
Display results in responsive grid (1 col mobile, 2 tablet, 4 desktop)
Each result is a Card with: name, degree, address, view button
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Implemented: Search page with ?q and ?page query params, Prisma contains (ILIKE) on full_name/degree/address, responsive grid (1/2/4 cols), Card with decorator per type, 'No results found' with category links, pagination with 20 per page and page number navigation. Typecheck passes. Browser verification noted as needed.

userStories.title: Search results page: Filters
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to filter search results by type, specialty, and location.
acceptanceCriteria: Filters update URL params and re-query
Active filters shown as tags that can be removed
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Implemented: Type filter (DOCTOR/DENTIST/PHARMACIST) and Location filter (from distinct addresses). Filters use border-2 border-foreground styling. Active filters shown as tags with X icon to remove. Results count shows 'X professionals found' with filter context. URL params preserved through pagination. Typecheck passes. Browser verification noted as needed.

userStories.title: Navigation header
userStories.description: As a patient, I want a consistent navigation header across pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Logo on left (geometric shapes: circle, square, triangle in primary colors)
Nav links: Home, Doctors, Dentists, Pharmacists
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Implemented: Header component with geometric logo (circle/square/triangle in primary colors), nav links (Home/Doctors/Dentists/Pharmacists), language switcher (EN/NE) with active state highlighting, login button (outline style with hard shadow), border-b-4 border-foreground, mobile hamburger menu with slide-down navigation, sticky positioning, active link highlighting. Typecheck passes. Browser verification noted as needed.

userStories.title: Footer component
userStories.description: As a patient, I want a footer with links and information.
acceptanceCriteria: Sections: About, For Doctors, For Clinics, Legal
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Implemented: Footer component with bg-foreground (#121212) and white text. Four sections (About, For Doctors, For Clinics, Legal) with internal links. Copyright notice with dynamic year. Social links (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram) with SVG icons. Bauhaus logo and 'Made in Nepal' decorative element. Integrated into [lang] layout with flex-col min-h-screen for sticky footer. Typecheck passes. Browser verification noted as needed.

userStories.title: Sitemap generation
userStories.description: As the system, I need to generate sitemaps for Google to discover all professional pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Create app/sitemap.ts using Next.js sitemap convention
Generate URLs for all professionals (doctor, dentist, pharmacist pages)
Split into multiple sitemaps if >50k URLs (sitemap index)
userStories.notes: Implemented: app/sitemap.ts created with Next.js sitemap convention using generateSitemaps for sitemap index support. Generates URLs for all professionals with both en/ne language variants, includes static pages (home, search, category pages). Includes lastmod (from updated_at), changeFrequency (weekly), priority (0.7-1.0 based on page type and verification). Handles >50k URLs with sitemap index via generateSitemaps function. Accessible at /sitemap.xml. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: robots.txt and SEO basics
userStories.description: As the system, I need robots.txt and basic SEO configuration.
userStories.notes: Implemented: app/robots.ts created using Next.js MetadataRoute.Robots convention. Allows all crawlers and references sitemap.xml. Root layout.tsx updated with comprehensive default metadata including metadataBase, title template, description, keywords, OpenGraph, Twitter cards, robots directives, and Google verification placeholder. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: i18n setup: next-intl configuration
userStories.description: As a developer, I need internationalization configured for English and Nepali.
userStories.notes: Implemented: next-intl installed and configured. Created messages/en.json and messages/ne.json with translations for common strings, home page, nav, footer, search, doctor details, not found, and metadata. Middleware configured for locale detection with 'always' prefix strategy. URL structure /en/... and /ne/... working. Default locale 'en'. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Category page: Doctors listing
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to browse all doctors at /doctors with pagination.
acceptanceCriteria: SEO: title 'Doctors in Nepal | Swasthya', description
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Implemented: app/[lang]/doctors/page.tsx created with DOCTOR type listing, responsive grid (1/2/4 cols) with Card components, pagination with page numbers and ellipsis, SEO with generateMetadata (title, description, OpenGraph, Twitter), language alternates for en/ne, Bauhaus styling with blue accent. Typecheck passes. Browser verification noted as needed.

userStories.title: Category page: Dentists listing
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to browse all dentists at /dentists.
acceptanceCriteria: Display in grid of Cards with red accent color
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Implemented: app/[lang]/dentists/page.tsx created with DENTIST type filtering, responsive grid (1/2/4 cols) with Card components, red accent color (decorator, labels, count), pagination with page numbers and ellipsis, SEO with generateMetadata (title, description, OpenGraph, Twitter), language alternates for en/ne. Links to /doctor/[slug] route for now. Typecheck passes. Browser verification noted as needed.

userStories.title: Category page: Pharmacists listing
userStories.description: As a patient, I want to browse all pharmacists at /pharmacists.
acceptanceCriteria: Display in grid of Cards with yellow accent color
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Authentication: NextAuth setup
userStories.description: As a developer, I need authentication configured for user login.

userStories.title: Authentication: Login and Register pages
userStories.description: As a user, I want to login or register on the platform.
acceptanceCriteria: Forms with email, password inputs (Bauhaus styled)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Claim profile: Claim button and search
userStories.description: As a doctor, I want to search for and claim my profile.
acceptanceCriteria: Add 'Claim this profile' button on unclaimed professional pages (only shown if user logged in)
Create app/[lang]/claim/page.tsx with search by registration number
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Claim profile: Verification request form
userStories.description: As a doctor, I want to submit verification documents for my claim.
acceptanceCriteria: Create claim form after professional selected
Upload fields: Government ID, NMC certificate (file upload)
Submit creates VerificationRequest in database with status=PENDING
Show success message with 'pending review' status
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Admin: Claims dashboard
userStories.description: As an admin, I want to review and approve/reject profile claims.
acceptanceCriteria: List pending VerificationRequests with: user email, professional name, submitted date
Approve button: sets status=APPROVED, links professional.claimed_by to user
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Profile edit: Edit form for verified professionals
userStories.description: As a verified doctor, I want to edit my profile details.
acceptanceCriteria: Create app/[lang]/dashboard/profile/page.tsx (protected, must have claimed profile)
Editable fields: bio, consultation_fee, languages, education details (stored in meta)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
